nodes.text: An electronic translator was a device that could automatically translate between various languages.

Some electronic translators were used to translate writings from different languages and read them aloud in Galactic Basic Standard. Other such devices could translate speech in another language to Basic and vice versa, like the Ithorian translators or the vocalizer masks worn by Anomids.
Electronic translator variants used in the Galaxy included the personal translators, Personal Universal Translators, translatacomps, VoxBoxes, electronic masks and transliterators.
The Hutts used an early translation device called a language convertor lexicon even before the times of the Galactic Republic to contact the Vodrans.

More advanced electronic translators were already in use in the galaxy around 3997 BBY—that year, the Jedi Exar Kun used one to translate a pair of Sith scrolls and therefore uncover the identity of the Sith homeworld of Korriban.
